headline.main: DAWN IS ZERO HOUR; British and Canadians Storm Over Narrow Strait of Messina ROME SAYS NOTHING Allies Invade on Fourth Anniversary of Their War Declaration

lead_paragraph: ALLIED HEADQUARTERS IN NORTH AFRICA, Friday, Sept. 3 -- The Allies have breached the "Fortress of Europe." On the fourth anniversary of the British and French declaration of war against Germany, Allied troops are striving to establish a bridgehead on the Italian side of the Strait of Messina.
abstract: Brit and Canadian forces of 8th Army cross Messina Strait to Calabrian Peninsula
snippet: ALLIED HEADQUARTERS IN NORTH AFRICA, Friday, Sept. 3 -- The Allies have breached the "Fortress of Europe." On the fourth anniversary of the British and French declaration of war against Germany, Allied troops are striving to establish a bridgehead...

byline.original: By MILTON BRACKERBy Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES
